intro: Voacanga zenkeri, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds covered in a sticky, fleshy aril. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
